abstract.p: Draft Worldwide acquires Fuel Advertising, Toronto; True North Communications acquires Britain's Opus Group and Brazil's Datamidia (S)

block.p: Two agencies are making acquisitions for undisclosed terms.

Draft Worldwide in Chicago, part of the Interpublic Group of Companies, acquired Fuel Advertising in Toronto, which has 90 employees and revenue estimated at $10.8 million from clients like the Hudson's Bay Company and the Ontario Ministry of Tourism. Fuel will operate as an autonomous unit of Draft; it is Draft's third acquisition in Canada in less than two years. Richard H. Fisher, 55, continues as president and chief executive at Fuel.
Two agencies are making acquisitions for undisclosed terms.

Draft Worldwide in Chicago, part of the Interpublic Group of Companies, acquired Fuel Advertising in Toronto, which has 90 employees and revenue estimated at $10.8 million from clients like the Hudson's Bay Company and the Ontario Ministry of Tourism. Fuel will operate as an autonomous unit of Draft; it is Draft's third acquisition in Canada in less than two years. Richard H. Fisher, 55, continues as president and chief executive at Fuel.

And True North Communications in Chicago acquired the Opus Group in Basingstoke, England, a customer relationship marketing agency, and Datamidia in Sao Paulo, Brazil, an agency specializing in digital and database communications. Opus and Datamidia, with more than 100 employees working for clients like Compaq Computer and Royal Dutch/ Shell, become operating units of FCBi, the interactive marketing unit of the FCB Worldwide division of True North.
